# Examples of Interactive Graphics

## Using `htmlwidgets` for displaying tabular data

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
    library(htmlwidgets)
    library(DT)
})
data("airquality")
data("mtcars")
```

```{r}
datatable(airquality, options = list(pageLength = 7))
```

-----------------------------------------------------------------
## Using interactive plots with `plotly` and `ggplot2`

```{r}
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
    library(ggplot2)
    library(plotly)
})
mtcars$gear <- factor(mtcars$gear,levels=c(3,4,5),
  	labels=c("3gears","4gears","5gears")) 
mtcars$am <- factor(mtcars$am,levels=c(0,1),
  	labels=c("Automatic","Manual")) 
mtcars$cyl <- factor(mtcars$cyl,levels=c(4,6,8),
   labels=c("4cyl","6cyl","8cyl"))
p <- qplot(hp, mpg, data=mtcars, shape=am, color=am, 
   facets=gear~cyl, size=I(3),
   xlab="Horsepower", ylab="Miles per Gallon")
ggplotly(p)
```
